alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 8:44PM CDT until July 08 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CHEYENNE COUNTY... At 844 PM CDT, emergency management reported that standing water persists on a few streets and in other low lying areas in the city of St. Francis. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... St. Francis, Bird City and Wheeler. Thunderstorms have progressed well south of Cheyenne County, Kansas. Additional rainfall is not anticipated. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
